docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To install and run OpenPAV, follow these steps:

  1. Clone the repository: bash git clone https://github.com/example/OpenPAV.git

  2. Install dependencies: bash pip install -r requirements.txt

  3. Start the documentation server: bash mkdocs serve

docs.title: Model Calibration
docs.text: OpenPAV supports calibration for various vehicle kinematic models, including IDM, Linear, and Machine Learning-based models. Detailed guides are provided in this section.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: OpenPAV provides tools and datasets to simulate and study automated vehicle models. This documentation outlines the project goals, features, and how to use the platform effectively.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Select a vehicle model and algorithm using the interactive tool on the home page.
  2. Generate the parameter file by clicking 'Generate and Download'.
  3. Use the parameter file in your preferred simulation environment.

docs.title: Simulation Integration
docs.text: Learn how to integrate OpenPAV-generated parameter files into popular simulation platforms like SUMO and Vissim. Step-by-step instructions are available for each platform.

docs.title: Vehicle and Model Selection
docs.text:
Use the form below to select your vehicle and algorithm model. The generated file will be available for download.

Select Vehicle Model: --Select-- Tesla Audi Benz Select Algorithm Model: --Select-- Intelligent Driver Model (IDM) Linear Model Machine Learning Model Select Parameter File Type: --Select-- Original Parameters Vissim Parameters SUMO Parameters Generate and Download
